snippet: “I want to come to the U.S. to rest,” said the dissident lawyer Chen Guangcheng, speaking from Beijing to members of Congress by way of a cellphone held up to a microphone.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: “I want to come to the U.S. to rest,” said the dissident lawyer Chen Guangcheng, speaking from Beijing to members of Congress by way of a cellphone held up to a microphone.

headline.seo: Released From Embassy, Dissident Now Says He Wants to Leave China
headline.main: From China, Activist Pleads for Help in Call to U.S. Hearing
headline.print_headline: Dissident Pleads for Help via Telephone Call to Congressional Hearing

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
